page.title: 16Lymm's French Connection.
page.content: Since 1968 Lymm has been twinned with the town of Meung-sur-Loire in France.From the outset the emphasis of the association has been more upon individual contact and exchange than upon official visits.Though the organising committees on each side of the channel,at least one party travels between the towns each year and is hosted and entertained by families on the other side.Out of such trips has grown a steadily increasing number of personal friendships,including marriage.These are consided the real fruits and raison d'etre of the twinning. The twinning society has always been happy to assist group exchanges with advice and information.Most importantly there have for many years been exchanges between Lymm Oughtrington High School and the secondary school.
